text:
In Texas, some powerful lobbyists and a broad coalition of lawmakers want to expand access to medical marijuana. 

But they face a major obstacle in the Texas Senate: Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick
Latest from @AlexSamuelsx5 
https://www.texastribune.org/2019/03/19/texas-medical-cannabis-dan-patrick-senate-hurdle/ … #txlege
author: amanbatheja

text:
Texas Legislature meets once every two years for 140 days. 

Today was Day 70 of the 2019 session. 

Where are things halfway through the session? 

Some are wondering if they'll finish in time 

#txlege
author: amanbatheja

text:

text:
"I can't right now," O'Rourke told reporters when asked if he would reveal how much his campaign raised in its first 24 hours.

You could, a reporter pointed out.

"You're right," O'Rourke said before clarifying somewhat playfully. "I choose not to."
author: amanbatheja

text: This from Beto O'Rourke's fundraising email yesterday strongly implies his campaign was planning to release how much they raised in the first 24 hours. Today he told reporters "I choose not to" share them
author: amanbatheja

text:
On his campaign website, @BetoORourke's 404 error page is a video of him wiping off a car bumper after an apparent fender bender and then covering it up with one of his bumper stickers 
https://betoorourke.com/404

text: An Iowa dispatch from @PatrickSvitek: "Beto O'Rourke all but picked up where he left off in his blockbuster U.S. Senate run last year...He even used some of the same anecdotes"

text: The greatest trick Netflix ever pulled was convincing me to try a show with a laugh track in 2019, getting me hooked and then cancelling it.

text:

"The factional feud within the Bexar County Democratic Party reached new heights Wednesday, as the organization’s leader asked the FBI to investigate current and former party officials."

text: So it's a little thing but I'm genuinely curious if Beto O'Rourke will curse in any of his speeches in Iowa or New Hampshire, with a whole lot more people watching and many of them ready to overanylyze everything.
author: amanbatheja

text: Beto O'Rourke's language got a whole lot more attention when he gave his concession speech on election night
author: amanbatheja

text: While it's funny to watch O'Rourke cursing, I also though the video demonstrated one of O'Rourke's greatest strengths: his natural ability to convey anger without sounding angry
author: amanbatheja

text: We published this fun supercut of Beto O'Rourke dropping f-bombs in 2017 — when very few were even aware that the leading Democratic candidate for Senate in Texas was casually cursing in speeches.
author: amanbatheja

text: Beto O'Rourke on his DWI to @VanityFair: “I think I walked home from county jail—that [my dad] had helped build—I just got home and you just feel like a total piece of shit, and you kind of are”
